meanings.definition: The amount that a nest can hold.
meanings.sent1: The robin gathered a nestful of twigs to build its home.
meanings.sent2: The bird's nest was a nestful of soft feathers and dry grass.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel found a nestful of acorns hidden in the tree.
meanings.sent4: The attic was a nestful of memories, each box holding a piece of the past.
meanings.sent5: The basket was a nestful of colorful Easter eggs, ready for the hunt.

meanings.definition: Containing or full of a nest.
meanings.sent1: The tree was nestful with chirping birds in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The cozy cabin was nestful with the sounds of baby birds in the eaves.
meanings.sent3: The garden shed became nestful with the arrival of a family of mice.
meanings.sent4: The old barn was nestful with swallows darting in and out, building their nests.
meanings.sent5: The attic was nestful with the fluttering of wings as the bats made it their home.
